string-array.name: did_you_know
string-array.item: Infants usually retain antimeasles immunoglobulins (antibodies) transmitted from the mother during pregnancy for up to one year.
The venom of the lesser Asian scorpion contains proteins that are toxic to Plasmodium falciparum, a pathogenic parasite that causes malaria in humans.
Some vaccinations contain preservatives, which are used to prevent contamination with bacteria or fungi.
The DTPw-HB/Hib pentavalent vaccine protects against 5 childhood diseases.
BCG has a small protective effect against leprosy of around 26%, although it is not used specifically for this purpose.
